titleStmt.title: W. F. Barret to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7517

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Enclosed I send you a Copy of Judgment Jefferson Circuit Court and petition for remission of fine -- you can see what Petitioner represents. Mr Roberts My partner says it is a very meritorious case he knows the parties sayd they are poor and all of them a large family of children. If consistent with your notions of duty I should like the fine remitted Mr Roberts has caused that portion due the comths atty to be paid before asking for clemency. I should send Mr Tate the assistant Sec his fee of $2 -- but apprehend it would look a little premature if not presumptious and Saucy. If your Excelency should interfere in the case hower I will remit to Mr PTate or Page --
